meanings.definition: Form an incorrect opinion about someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I misjudge his intentions and thought he was being mean, but he was just shy.
meanings.sent2: Don't misjudge a book by its cover; she may seem quiet, but she's actually very friendly.
meanings.sent3: I misjudge the situation and ended up bringing a winter coat to a summer picnic!
meanings.sent4: She tends to misjudge people's reactions, thinking they are upset when they are just surprised.
meanings.sent5: It's easy to misjudge distance in the dark, so be careful when walking at night.

meanings.definition: Make a wrong or unfair decision about someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The judge must not misjudge the defendant based on appearance alone.
meanings.sent2: It would be unfair to misjudge her work ethic just because she's quiet.
meanings.sent3: I misjudge the size of the pizza and ordered way too much for the party!
meanings.sent4: He tends to misjudge the impact of his words, unintentionally hurting others.
meanings.sent5: In a rush, it's easy to misjudge the best route and end up getting lost.
